intro: Bomarea edulis var. maranensis, commonly known as the Marañon arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are the primary edible part. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in cloud forests. Its leaves are large, lance-shaped, and have a velvety texture. The tubers are rich in starch and are traditionally used as a food source by indigenous communities.
